app.title: Supplementary Materials
app.p: The following are available online at https://www.mdpi.com/article/10.3390/antiox10050781/s1, Figure S1: The impact of the addition of herbs (sage— Salvia officinalis L., basil— Ocimum basilicum L., thyme— Thymus vulgaris L.) on α-tocopherol content in oils cold-pressed from seeds of eight different species. Figure S2: The impact of the addition of herbs (sage— Salvia officinalis L., basil— Ocimum basilicum L., thyme— Thymus vulgaris L.) on γ-tocopherol content in oils cold-pressed from seeds of eight different species. Figure S3: The impact of the addition of herbs ((sage— Salvia officinalis L., basil— Ocimum basilicum L., thyme— Thymus vulgaris L.) on δ-tocopherol in oils cold-pressed from seeds of eight different species. Figure S4: Contents of α-tocopherol (A), γ-tocopherol (B) and δ-tocopherol (C) in oil cakes of eight species after cold-press of oil. Table S1: The impact of addition of herbs on total content (sum) of essential oils [μg/g] in oils cold-pressed from eight plant species–preliminary analysis [ 77].
